intro: Tiquilia plicata, commonly known as the narrowleaf tiquilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its linear, pinnately compound leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Tiquilia plicata is also known for its ability to produce a milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in the Malvaceae family.
